p: Although the immune mechanisms involved in the control of CHIKV disease are not fully characterized, CHIKV-infected humans show different timing of CD4 + and CD8 + T cell responses in the acute phase of infection. CHIKV-specific cytolytic CD8 + T lymphocyte-mediated immune response displays a peak at the first day post-illness onset [ 12], while the corresponding CD4 + T lymphocytes is increased around the end of the acute phase [ 12]. Abundant activated CD8 + T lymphocytes, responsible for destruction of the infected cells [ 13], can be detected in blood samples from patients two months postinfection [ 14]. In addition, the production of cytokines by CD4 + T helper lymphocytes stimulates the cell-mediated and antibody immune responses against CHIKV.
